description.narrative: The Solomon Islands Truth and Reconciliation Commission (TRC) provides a base as a forum where the Ethnic Tensions (1998-2003) victims and perpetrators can gain a clearer understanding of the past and facilitate reconciliation. Unlike similar bodies in other jurisdictions, the TRC will not rely on incentives such as amnesty from criminal prosecution or compensation payments to bring perpetrators and victims forward. It will comprise five commissioners, including two non-nationals. Funding will be provided through UNDP who will take the role of lead donor with responsibility for liaison with SIG on overall progress of the TRC. The total value of this initiative is $0.5 million to be expensed during the 2009-10 financial year.
